content:
3.67 
Effect of the dissolution of the marriage on the spouses' property rights 
1. The divorce shall have legal effects on the property rights of the spouses as from the date on which the divorce proceedings are instituted before the court or as from the date on which the agreement on the consequences of the divorce, certified by a notary public, enters into force. 
2. A spouse, other than one who has been found guilty of the dissolution of the marriage, may request the court to declare that the divorce has produced legal effects on the matrimonial property of the spouses as from the date on which they actually ceased to live together.
